trans-unit.source: Efficient list queries in Azure Batch | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Efficient list queries in Azure Batch | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn to reduce the amount of data returned and increase performance when querying Azure Batch pools, jobs, tasks, compute nodes, and more.
trans-unit.target: Learn to reduce the amount of data returned and increase performance when querying Azure Batch pools, jobs, tasks, compute nodes, and more.

trans-unit.source: Azure Batch is big compute, and in a production environment, entities like jobs, tasks, and compute nodes can number in the thousands.
trans-unit.target: Azure Batch is big compute, and in a production environment, entities like jobs, tasks, and compute nodes can number in the thousands.

trans-unit.source: Obtaining information on these items can therefore generate a large amount of data that must be transferred on each query.
trans-unit.target: Obtaining information on these items can therefore generate a large amount of data that must be transferred on each query.

trans-unit.source: Limiting the number of items and type of information returned for each will increase the speed of your queries and therefore the performance of your application.
trans-unit.target: Limiting the number of items and type of information returned for each will increase the speed of your queries and therefore the performance of your application.

trans-unit.source: The following <linkText>Batch .NET</linkText><title></title> API methods are examples of operations that virtually every application using Azure Batch must perform, often frequently:
trans-unit.target: The following <linkText>Batch .NET</linkText><title></title> API methods are examples of operations that virtually every application using Azure Batch must perform, often frequently:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ListTasks</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ListTasks</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ListJobs</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ListJobs</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ListPools</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ListPools</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ListComputeNodes</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ListComputeNodes</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Monitoring is a common use case--determining the capacity and status of a pool requires that all compute nodes (VMs) in a pool be queried, for example.
trans-unit.target: Monitoring is a common use case--determining the capacity and status of a pool requires that all compute nodes (VMs) in a pool be queried, for example.

trans-unit.source: Another example is to query a job's tasks to determine if any of those tasks are still queued.
trans-unit.target: Another example is to query a job's tasks to determine if any of those tasks are still queued.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, a rich set of data is required, but in others, only a count of the total number of items or a collection of items that are in a certain state is required.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, a rich set of data is required, but in others, only a count of the total number of items or a collection of items that are in a certain state is required.

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that both the number of items returned and the amount of data required to represent those items can be very large.
trans-unit.target: It is important to note that both the number of items returned and the amount of data required to represent those items can be very large.

trans-unit.source: Simply querying for lots of items resulting in large responses can lead to a number of problems:
trans-unit.target: Simply querying for lots of items resulting in large responses can lead to a number of problems:

trans-unit.source: Batch API response times can become too slow.
trans-unit.target: Batch API response times can become too slow.

trans-unit.source: The larger the number of items, the longer the query time required by the Batch service.
trans-unit.target: The larger the number of items, the longer the query time required by the Batch service.

trans-unit.source: Large numbers of items have to be broken into chunks, and therefore the client library may need to make multiple API calls to the service to obtain all of the items for a single list.
trans-unit.target: Large numbers of items have to be broken into chunks, and therefore the client library may need to make multiple API calls to the service to obtain all of the items for a single list.

trans-unit.source: API processing by the application calling Batch will take longer when there are more items to process.
trans-unit.target: API processing by the application calling Batch will take longer when there are more items to process.

trans-unit.source: More memory will be consumed by the application calling Batch when there are more and/or larger items.
trans-unit.target: More memory will be consumed by the application calling Batch when there are more and/or larger items.

trans-unit.source: More and/or larger items will lead to increased network traffic.
trans-unit.target: More and/or larger items will lead to increased network traffic.

trans-unit.source: This will take longer to transfer and, depending on application architecture, may result in increased network charges for data transferred outside of the region of the Batch account.
trans-unit.target: This will take longer to transfer and, depending on application architecture, may result in increased network charges for data transferred outside of the region of the Batch account.

trans-unit.source: For all Batch APIs the following apply:
trans-unit.target: For all Batch APIs the following apply:

trans-unit.source: Each property name is a string that maps to the property of the object
trans-unit.target: Each property name is a string that maps to the property of the object

trans-unit.source: All property names are case sensitive, but property values are case insensitive
trans-unit.target: All property names are case sensitive, but property values are case insensitive

trans-unit.source: Property names and casing are as the elements appear in the Batch REST API
trans-unit.target: Property names and casing are as the elements appear in the Batch REST API

trans-unit.source: Date/time strings may be specified in one of two formats, and must be preceded with DateTime
trans-unit.target: Date/time strings may be specified in one of two formats, and must be preceded with DateTime

trans-unit.source: W3CDTF (e.g. creationTime gt DateTime'2011-05-08T08:49:37Z')
trans-unit.target: W3CDTF (e.g. creationTime gt DateTime'2011-05-08T08:49:37Z')

trans-unit.source: RFC1123 (e.g. creationTime gt DateTime'Sun, 08 May 2011 08:49:37 GMT')
trans-unit.target: RFC1123 (e.g. creationTime gt DateTime'Sun, 08 May 2011 08:49:37 GMT')

trans-unit.source: Boolean strings are either "true" or "false"
trans-unit.target: Boolean strings are either "true" or "false"

trans-unit.source: Specifying an invalid property or operator will result in a "400 (Bad Request)" error
trans-unit.target: Specifying an invalid property or operator will result in a "400 (Bad Request)" error

trans-unit.source: The Batch .NET API provides the ability to reduce both the number of items returned in a list and the amount of information returned for each item by specifying the <linkText>DetailLevel</linkText><title></title> of a query.
trans-unit.target: The Batch .NET API provides the ability to reduce both the number of items returned in a list and the amount of information returned for each item by specifying the <linkText>DetailLevel</linkText><title></title> of a query.

trans-unit.source: DetailLevel is an abstract base class, and an <linkText>ODATADetailLevel</linkText><title></title> object actually needs to be created and passed as the parameter to appropriate methods.
trans-unit.target: DetailLevel is an abstract base class, and an <linkText>ODATADetailLevel</linkText><title></title> object actually needs to be created and passed as the parameter to appropriate methods.

trans-unit.source: An ODataDetailLevel object has three public string properties that can be specified either in the constructor or set directly:
trans-unit.target: An ODataDetailLevel object has three public string properties that can be specified either in the constructor or set directly:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>FilterClause</linkText><title></title> – filter and potentially reduce the number of returned items
trans-unit.target: <linkText>FilterClause</linkText><title></title> – filter and potentially reduce the number of returned items

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SelectClause</linkText><title></title> – specify a subset of property values to be returned for each item, reducing the item and response size
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SelectClause</linkText><title></title> – specify a subset of property values to be returned for each item, reducing the item and response size

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ExpandClause</linkText><title></title> – return all required data in one call as opposed to multiple calls
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ExpandClause</linkText><title></title> – return all required data in one call as opposed to multiple calls

trans-unit.source: An instance of DetailLevel configured with Select and Expand clauses can also be passed to appropriate Get methods such as <linkText>PoolOperations.GetPool</linkText><title></title> to limit the amount of data returned.
trans-unit.target: An instance of DetailLevel configured with Select and Expand clauses can also be passed to appropriate Get methods such as <linkText>PoolOperations.GetPool</linkText><title></title> to limit the amount of data returned.

trans-unit.source: The number of items returned can be reduced by a filter string.
trans-unit.target: The number of items returned can be reduced by a filter string.

trans-unit.source: One or more property values with qualifiers can be specified to ensure only the items relevant to your query are returned.
trans-unit.target: One or more property values with qualifiers can be specified to ensure only the items relevant to your query are returned.

trans-unit.source: For example, perhaps you wish to list only the running tasks for a job, or list only the compute nodes that are ready to run tasks.
trans-unit.target: For example, perhaps you wish to list only the running tasks for a job, or list only the compute nodes that are ready to run tasks.

trans-unit.source: FilterClause is a string consisting of one or more expressions, with an expression consisting of a property name, operator, and value.
trans-unit.target: FilterClause is a string consisting of one or more expressions, with an expression consisting of a property name, operator, and value.

trans-unit.source: The properties that can be specified are specific to each API call, as are the operators supported for each property.
trans-unit.target: The properties that can be specified are specific to each API call, as are the operators supported for each property.

trans-unit.source: Multiple expressions can be combined using the logical operators and and or.
trans-unit.target: Multiple expressions can be combined using the logical operators and and or.

trans-unit.source: For example, this filter string returns only running tasks whose displayName starts with "MyTask":
trans-unit.target: For example, this filter string returns only running tasks whose displayName starts with "MyTask":

trans-unit.source: Each Batch REST API article below contains a table specifying the supported properties and operations on those properties for the different list operations.
trans-unit.target: Each Batch REST API article below contains a table specifying the supported properties and operations on those properties for the different list operations.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the pools in an account</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the pools in an account</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the compute nodes in a pool</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the compute nodes in a pool</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the jobs in an account</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the jobs in an account</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the status of the job preparation and job release tasks for a job</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the status of the job preparation and job release tasks for a job</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the job schedules in an account</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the job schedules in an account</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the jobs associated with a job schedule</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the jobs associated with a job schedule</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the tasks associated with a job</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the tasks associated with a job</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the files associated with a task</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the files associated with a task</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the certificates in an account</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the certificates in an account</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List the files on a node</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List the files on a node</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: When specifying properties in any of the three clause types, ensure that the property name and case matches that of their Batch REST API element counterparts.
trans-unit.target: When specifying properties in any of the three clause types, ensure that the property name and case matches that of their Batch REST API element counterparts.

trans-unit.source: For example, when working with the .NET CloudTask, you must specify state instead of State even though the .NET property is CloudTask.State.
trans-unit.target: For example, when working with the .NET CloudTask, you must specify state instead of State even though the .NET property is CloudTask.State.

trans-unit.source: To verify proper name and case for the state property, for example, you'd check the element name in Get information about a task in the Batch REST API documentation.
trans-unit.target: To verify proper name and case for the state property, for example, you'd check the element name in Get information about a task in the Batch REST API documentation.

trans-unit.source: The property values that are returned for each item can be limited by using a select string.
trans-unit.target: The property values that are returned for each item can be limited by using a select string.

trans-unit.source: A list of properties for an item can be specified, and then only those property values are returned.
trans-unit.target: A list of properties for an item can be specified, and then only those property values are returned.

trans-unit.source: A <linkText>SelectClause</linkText><title></title> is a string consisting of a comma-separated list of property names.
trans-unit.target: A <linkText>SelectClause</linkText><title></title> is a string consisting of a comma-separated list of property names.

trans-unit.source: Any combination of properties available for an item returned by a list operation may be specified.
trans-unit.target: Any combination of properties available for an item returned by a list operation may be specified.

trans-unit.source: The number of API calls can be reduced with an expand clause.
trans-unit.target: The number of API calls can be reduced with an expand clause.

trans-unit.source: More detailed information for each list item can be obtained with a single API call as opposed to first obtaining the list and then iterating over the list, making a call for each item in the list.
trans-unit.target: More detailed information for each list item can be obtained with a single API call as opposed to first obtaining the list and then iterating over the list, making a call for each item in the list.

trans-unit.source: An <linkText>ExpandClause</linkText><title></title> is similar to the select clause in that it controls whether certain data is returned in the results.
trans-unit.target: An <linkText>ExpandClause</linkText><title></title> is similar to the select clause in that it controls whether certain data is returned in the results.

trans-unit.source: The expand clause is supported only for job list, task list, and pool list, and currently only supports statistics information.
trans-unit.target: The expand clause is supported only for job list, task list, and pool list, and currently only supports statistics information.

trans-unit.source: When all properties are required and no select clause has been specified, then the expand clause must be used to get statistics information.
trans-unit.target: When all properties are required and no select clause has been specified, then the expand clause must be used to get statistics information.

trans-unit.source: If a select clause is used to obtain a subset of properties, then "stats" can also be specified in the select clause and the expand clause may be left null.
trans-unit.target: If a select clause is used to obtain a subset of properties, then "stats" can also be specified in the select clause and the expand clause may be left null.

trans-unit.source: Below you'll find a code snippet that uses the Batch .NET API to efficiently query the Batch service for the statistics of a specific set of pools.
trans-unit.target: Below you'll find a code snippet that uses the Batch .NET API to efficiently query the Batch service for the statistics of a specific set of pools.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, the Batch user has both test and production pools, with their test pool IDs prefixed with "test" and production pool IDs prefixed with "prod".
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, the Batch user has both test and production pools, with their test pool IDs prefixed with "test" and production pool IDs prefixed with "prod".

trans-unit.source: In the snippet, myBatchClient is a properly initialized instance of BatchClient.
trans-unit.target: In the snippet, myBatchClient is a properly initialized instance of BatchClient.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you always use filter and select clauses for your list API calls to ensure maximum efficiency and the best performance for your application.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you always use filter and select clauses for your list API calls to ensure maximum efficiency and the best performance for your application.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already, be sure to check out the Batch API documentation relevant to your development scenario
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already, be sure to check out the Batch API documentation relevant to your development scenario

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Batch REST</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Batch REST</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Batch .NET</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Batch .NET</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Grab the <linkText>Azure Batch samples</linkText><title></title> on GitHub and dig into the code
trans-unit.target: Grab the <linkText>Azure Batch samples</linkText><title></title> on GitHub and dig into the code
